caption:
This photograph depicts a woman engaging in a scientific or laboratory activity. The woman, who has long, dark hair and is wearing a white lab coat, is focused intently on her task. She is using a pair of tweezers to handle small, flat objects within a large, circular device that appears to be a heating or drying instrument, possibly a water bath. The device is labeled "COLE-PARMER INSTRUMENT & EQUIPMENT CO."

In the background, there are neatly stacked racks containing numerous slides or samples, indicating a setting that involves meticulous documentation or analyses. Above the workspace, there is a desk lamp that casts light directly onto the area where she is working, emphasizing her focus and the precision required for the task.

The overall environment suggests a professional laboratory setting where scientific research or experiments are conducted. The detail and equipment in the scene suggest the photograph was taken in the mid-to-late 20th century, considering the style of the equipment and overall ambiance.
title: EPA Gulf Breeze Laboratory: patho-biology lab. Linda Sharp, assistant to the pathobiologist, makes slides of histological sections. This is one of the procedures in the study of tissues and cells of estuarine and marine animals exposed to pesticides.
